channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Town Hall exhibit highlights artists with indigenous roots
item.description: The show, “We Know Who We Are,” will have an artists’ reception 6-8 p.m. May 13.
item.dc:creator: Diane Smith

item.title: New late-afternoon and St. Hilary school-bus routes to launch this fall
item.description: The agency behind the Yellow Bus Challenge will introduce a pilot late-afternoon route next school year to bring Reed Union district...
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon teen’s nonprofit aims to raise money for student tech
item.description: Natty Gove launched the Tech4Youth Foundation in February and is aiming to raise $11,000 to purchase laptops for 30 students in need.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A LinkedIn executive finds peace, purpose in Tiburon
item.description: Tiburon reminds Laura Parkinson of her hometown of Hallettsville, Texas, about 120 miles east of San Antonio.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Katherine McLaughlin
item.description: Katherine Clifford Higgins McLaughlin passed away peacefully April 8th, just days after her 90th birthday.
item.dc:creator: Reader submitted

item.title: Bluff Point property is back on the market with an 81% markdown
item.description: It includes about 2,000 feet of shoreline and carries county approval for an 18,227-square-foot estate.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Couple sues Belvedere over $254K fine for delayed construction
item.description: The claim says the penalty violated their constitutional rights of due process and against excessive fines.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Hessel

item.title: Officials warn Tiburon Boulevard bike-lane plan risks bus stops, traffic and safety
item.description: Caltrans’ 2026 project to rehabilitate and repave Tiburon Boulevard includes bike lanes that would eliminate four school-bus stops.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez
